Description: Denver Health and Hospital Authority entered into a settlement agreement to resolve allegations that it submitted claims to Medicare for services provided to individuals it knew, or should have known, were incarcerated or in custody.
Agency: Health & Human Services Department Office of Inspector General
Health & Human Services Department Office of Inspector General
Notes: Source document obtained through a Freedom of Information Act request to the agency.

Description: Denver Health and Hospital Authority, doing business as Denver Heath Medical Center, agreed to pay the United States and the State of Colorado $6,300,000 to settle allegations that it overbilled Medicare and Medicaid by misclassifying patients for hospital admissions.

Company: Denver Health and Hospital Authority dba Denver Heath Medical Center
Description: Denver Health Medical Center agreed to pay $6.3 million in settlement of allegations it misclassified patients so it received higher Medicare and Medicaid payments. The settlement was split between the United States, Colorado, and a whistleblower. The settlement was also announced by the Justice Department; see the Violation Tracker entry at https://violationtracker.goodjobsfirst.org/violation-tracker/co-denver-health-and-hospital-authority-0
